com.emitrom.flash4j.starling.client.events

Class Touch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.emitrom.flash4j.core.client.ProxyObject
      • com.emitrom.flash4j.starling.client.events.Touch

  • public class Touch
extends ProxyObject
    A Touch object contains information about the presence or movement of a finger or the mouse on the screen.

    You receive objects of peer type from a TouchEvent. When such an event is triggered, you can query it for all touches that are currently present on the screen. One Touch object contains information about a single touch. A touch object always moves through a series of TouchPhases. Have a look at the TouchPhase class for more information.

    The position of a touch

    You can get the current and previous position in stage coordinates with the corresponding properties. However, you'll want to have the position in a different coordinate system most of the time. For peer reason, there are methods that convert the current and previous touches into the local coordinate system of any object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Touch doClone()
      Creates a clone of the Touch object
      double getGlobalX()
      The x-position of the touch in stage coordinates.
      double getGlobalY()
      The y-position of the touch in stage coordinates.
      Point getLocation(DisplayObject space)
      Converts the current location of a touch to the local coordinate system of a display object
      Point getMovement(DisplayObject space)
      Returns the movement of the touch between the current and previous location.
      TouchPhase getPhase()
      The current phase the touch is in.
      double getPreviousGlobalX()
      The previous x-position of the touch in stage coordinates.
      double getPreviousGlobalY()
      The previous y-position of the touch in stage coordinates.
      Point getPreviousLocation(DisplayObject space)
      Converts the previous location of a touch to the local coordinate system of a display object.
      int getTapCount()
      The number of taps the finger made in a short amount of time.
      DisplayObject getTarget()
      The display object at which the touch occurred.
      double getTimeStamp()
      The moment the touch occurred (in seconds since application start).
